node.title: Guitar-player, skateboarder Ji-Young will make Sesame Street history
node.alt: Puppets from the popular children's television program Sesame Street.
node.description: Ji-Young, the newest resident of Sesame Street, will be the first Asian American muppet on the show that initially airedÂ launched 52 years ago.
node.content:
["What's in a name? Well, for Ji-Young, the newest muppet resident of Sesame Street,\u00a0her name is a sign she was meant to live there.", "\"So, in Korean traditionally the two syllables they each mean something different and Ji means, like, smart or wise. And Young means, like, brave or courageous and strong,\" Ji-Young explained in an\u00a0interview.", "\"But we were looking it up and guess what? Ji also means sesame.\"", "At only 7 years old, Ji-Young is making history as the first Asian American muppet in the Sesame Street\u00a0canon.", "She is Korean American and has two passions: rocking out on her electric guitar and skateboarding.", "Ji-Young will formally be introduced in See Us Coming Together: A Sesame Street Special featuring actor Simu Liu and tennis player Naomi Osaka and airing on\u00a0Thanksgiving Day in the US.", "
'It's about this\u00a0message'
", "Some of Ji-Young's personality comes from her puppeteer\u00a041-year-old Kathleen Kim, 41, a\u00a0Korean American who got into puppetry in her 30s.", "\"I feel like I have a lot of weight that maybe I'm putting on myself to teach these lessons and to be this representative that I did not have as a kid,\" she said.", "Fellow puppeteer Leslie Carrara-Rudolph \u2014 who performs Abby Cadabby \u2014 reminded her that\u00a0\"it's not about us \u2026 It's about this message\".", "Ji-Young's existence is the culmination of a lot of discussions after the events of 2020 including the murder of George Floyd and\u00a0anti-Asian hate incidents.", "Sesame Street\u00a0reflected on how it could \"meet the moment,\" said Kay Wilson Stallings, executive vice-president of creative and production for Sesame Workshop, the non-profit organisation behind Sesame Street.", "Sesame Workshop established two task forces \u2014 one to look at its content and another to look at its own diversity.", "This resulted in\u00a0Coming Together, a multi-year initiative addressing how to talk to children about race, ethnicity and culture.", "\"When we knew we were going to be doing this work that was going to focus on the Asian and Pacific Islanders experience, we of course knew we needed to create an Asian muppet as well,\" Ms Stallings\u00a0said.", "These newer muppets \u2014 their personalities and their looks \u2014 were constructed in months when the process normally took at least a couple of years.", "There were outside experts and a cross-section of employees known as the \"culture trust\" who weighed in on every aspect of a new muppet, Ms Stallings said.", "For Ms Kim, it was crucial that Ji-Young not be \"generically pan-Asian\".", "\"Because that's something that all Asian Americans have experienced,\" she said.", "\"They kind of want to lump us into this monolithic Asian.", "\"So it was very important that she was specifically Korean American, not just like, generically Korean, but she was born here.\"", "", "
The cast of Sesame Street have not shied away from sensitive social issues over the decades.(Reuters: Larry Downing)
", "One thing Ji-Young will help teach children is how to be a good \"upstander\".", "Sesame Street first used the term on its The Power of We television special last year, which featured\u00a08-year-old African American muppet Tamir.", "Ms Stallings said an \"upstander\" would point out \"things that are wrong or something that someone does or says that is based on their negative attitude towards the person because of the colour of their skin or the language they speak or where they're from\".", "In See Us Coming Together,\u00a0Sesame Street is preparing for Neighbour Day where everyone shares food, music or dance from their culture.", "Ji-Young becomes upset after a kid, off-screen, tells her \"to go back home\".", "But she feels empowered after Sesame Street's other Asian American residents, guest stars and friends including Elmo assure her that she belongs as much as anyone else.", "The fact that Ji-Young was created to counter anti-Asian sentiment makes her more special to Ms Kim in some ways.", "\"I remember like the Atlanta shootings and how terrifying that was for me,\" she said.", "\"But then my other hope for Ji-Young is that she just normalises seeing different kinds of looking kids on TV.\"", "Vanessa Leung, co-executive director of Coalition for Asian American Children and Families, is excited about Ji-Young.", "\"It sparks curiosity and early understanding of the diversity of our community, the beauty in the diversity of our community,\" Ms Leung said.", "
Ernie is keen to try Korean food
", "As the new kid on the street, Ji-Young is looking forward to showing her friends and neighbours aspects of Korean culture such as the food.", "She loves cooking dishes including tteokbokki (chewy rice cakes) with her halmoni (grandmother).", "And she already has one Sesame Street\u00a0friend, Ernie, who wants a sample.", "\"I would love to try it,\" said Ernie, who joined Ji-Young's interview.", "\"You know, I've tried bulgogi,\" Ernie said.", "\"I really like bulgogi. I'm gonna guess that maybe old buddy Bert has not tried Korean food.\"", "Having already made several famous friends on Sesame Street,\u00a0is there anyone Ji-Young still really wants to meet?", "\"The Linda Lindas because they're so cool,\" Ji-Young said, referring to the teenage punk rock band.", "\"And they rock out and they're cool girls and most of them are Asian.", "They're my heroes. If we can get the Linda Lindas on Sesame Street,\u00a0I would show them around.\"", "AP"]
